rationale: The paper provides an implementation-actionable architecture for trajectory-level evolutionary factor mining with clear operator definitions and positive ablations. However, production confidence is constrained by missing uncertainty quantification, incomplete deterministic replication detail in the manuscript, and limited execution-friction realism.
rejection_reasons: Reject immediate autonomous production deployment because headline gains are presented without confidence intervals or significance testing.
Reject direct production promotion until deterministic reproduction artifacts (prompt/seed/code/data manifests) are available and validated.
Reject high-stakes rollout without deeper execution-friction stress tests beyond current backtest assumptions.
Reject broad generalization claims until additional out-of-period and multi-market robustness checks are completed.
recommendations: Implement trajectory archival, mutation/crossover operators, and symbolic constraint gating as a deterministic research framework.
Add repeated-seed evaluations with confidence intervals and statistical significance tests for headline comparisons.
Expand robustness testing to rolling windows and additional markets/assets beyond the paper's primary setup.
Integrate slippage/impact and liquidity stress modeling before any live-trading consideration.
follow_up_actions: Reproduce Table 1 and Table 2 with fixed seeds and immutable run manifests.
Quantify sensitivity to TopkDropout parameters and transaction-cost assumptions.
Run ablations isolating evolution gains from constrained one-shot factor generation.
Validate transfer performance on forward windows beyond 2025-12-26.
